Reviews.Title: “UMMM”
Reviews.Author: btbuilder59
Reviews.Content: What to say about the Giada Hotel. Ummm, the location was good if you use the bus system or the trains. The employees for the most part are pleasant but as for the hotel itself, it seems the owners don't put the money back into it. If you look at the pictures the hotel provides you, beware. It's easy to say that a hotel is just a place to sleep but if the mattresses were made the same year you Grandmother was born you can pretty much forget the sleep part. The rooms were clean but worn. Don't expect to fill up at their continental breakfast or think about a second cup of coffee without paying for it. If you need a hair drier be sure to pack one good for 220 v, and an extension cord if you hope to get near a mirror. We actually walked to "Vatican City" from there to see the sights along the way and then returned on a slightly different path to see more. It took about 1- 1 1/2 hours on the way there and a little more on the way back ( more to see on the return path). Someone needs to be the map person and plot it out before hand.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect place for the backpacker needing a bed and to shower.”
Reviews.Author: jonlester
Reviews.Content: This is the perfect place if you need a clean room and place to shower. The bed was somewhat comfy, breakfast was ok but the rooms were clean and is in a perfect location. The train station and Coloseum are both extremely close. The only thing that annoyed me was you had to go to the lobby to use the Internet. If you're on a budget and can live without all the pamperings of a nice hotel this is your place.

Reviews.Title: “We don't like it and we never stay in that hotel again”
Reviews.Author: kuletgin
Reviews.Content: Very poor and the staff were impolite. We had to wait till 3 pm for the rooms although we arrived about 10 am. We booked 4 days before we went to Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Basic hotel close to Termini station”
Reviews.Author: Woman50
Reviews.Content: I was looking for a non-expensive hotel (single room) close to Termini station for 2 nights, and found Hotel Giada on the website nyceRome.com. The hotel (3 stars) is quite basic, but clean, and it satisfied my needs. The room was simply furnished, but the bed was good. The breakfast was average. The location of the hotel was superb, 3 minutes from Termini station and 3 minutes from Maria Maggiore, so I felt I got fair value for the money. There are many 3 stars hotels in the same street as this hotel, so next time i may try another one.

Reviews.Title: “TERRIBLE AND DISGUSTING PLACE TO STAY IN”
Reviews.Author: Bubba186338
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Giada is completely different to what one sees on the internet, there is no comparison. Its dirty and depressing to stay in. Apart from the room having dirty walls and looking shabby altogether, there was a strong smell of dust as if the room had been closed for a month. I could barely breath, since I suffer from asthma, I had to sleep with the window open in order to have some clean air in the room, although it was quite cold outside. To top it up the electricity was coming and going from about 3am till 8am there were many intervals where electricity was cut out for a long period. All together I must say that the negative reviews I read were absolutely true and I was wrong in trying out this hotel. I strongly don't recommend anyone to stay at this hotel. It is definitely not a 3 star hotel but a dirty guest house. I felt absolutely mislead by the photos published on the net in basically every site I visited.

Reviews.Title: “Great value for money!”
Reviews.Author: IgorUKBR
Reviews.Content: We've traveled to Rome without booking a hotel in advance and since it wasn't high season yet it wasn't that hard to find one. We arrived at the Termini (the Central Train Station) and we decided to pick a street and see if we could find a hotel close enough. Well, luckily there are loads of hotels around the Termini which is only logical: pretty much everyone who arrives in town from the airports or nearby towns, arrive at the train station and walking around with lugagge in a big city like Rome can be literally a major pain in the neck (arms, legs and shoulders too!). We were in a group of 7 adults and were looking for a budget hotel with breakfast and Giada was the first one who caught our attention. The hotel guy offered us a good deal and even said "You will not find a better deal, I'm sure of that" and he was right, after asking around in 3 or 4 other hotels his deal was the best one, so we went for it. The Rooms Our group got split into 2 rooms. Both rooms were about the same size, the only difference is that one had 1 single and 1 double bed and the other one had 2 double beds. Rooms were quite large and cozy but very simple and the bathroom was very tiny but its job perfectly. The only thing that I did not like about the room I stayed at is that it didn't have a windown facing the street. The window faced the interior of the building (the building was squared with a hole in the middle) and all you could see was grey walls and down there water pumps and things like that. At least at night our room was very dark and quiet which is something I like. THE BREAKFAST Very good breakfast, nothing extremely fancy but there were loads of options from juices to breads, croissants, fruits, cereals, etc... The waitress was not the smiling type of person and not exactly nice but she did her job. The breakfast room was a bit small and things could get crowded at times. THE STAFF Like I said the breakfast lady wasn't all smiles but she was ok. The reception people were always nice, especially the guy who offered us the deal. I've lived in Italy before so I know that it's not always easy to find sympathetic people. **PROS** -location -value **CONS** -no luxury at all If you are the kind looking for a nice fancy hotel, stay away from this but if you are only looking for a decent place to spend the night, this is for you!

Reviews.Title: “Possible with a wheelchair - no atmosphere”
Reviews.Author: Wheelchairtravel
Reviews.Content: My main reason to book hotel Giada was because it was accessible with a wheelchair. Upon arrival the receptionaist seemed quite astonished that I was travelling all by myself. At the entrance there is one small step which is barely worth mentioning. The elevator is spatious (a rare thing for a hotel in Rome) and my single room was accessible at least for the main part. I was able to get into the bathroom. It was not possible to manouvre a lot inside the room and I could only get onto the bed from the foot end. For the rest on the plus side I can say the hotel was clean and not far from the railway station and the staff was friendly. I was probably lucky with the positioning of my room, which was at the back of the hotel so not facing the busy street. My bed was rather hard, yet I was able to sleep without waking up with a backache. On the negative side I can say that the hotel lacks any atmosphere, the rooms' interior was "spartan": a very tiny TV set (that did not function) and a bible that was about it. Breakfast was included but barely worth taking. Besides the one croissant I got from the hotel staff, and the bad coffee (in Italy?), there is a choice of what tastes like watered down orange-juice and stale buns. Definately not three stars but a reasonable price for Rome and a good place if you just need a bed and don't care about atmosphere or breakfast (which you can take in many nearbye places anyway).

Reviews.Title: “Clean, convenient, good location”
Reviews.Author: Seaside-Sarah
Reviews.Content: The staff here are very friendly and helpful. Room was a small single which felt quite depressing at first but I spent very little time there so it really didn't matter. Bed was comfortable. Shower clean with plenty of hot water. There were some students shouting in the corridor a lot one night but I was so tired they barely kept me awake. The area, just 2 or 3 streets down from the train station felt perfectly safe and there are plenty of other hotels in the area too. Friends stayed in a separate hotel just a block away. Their room was bigger but they still had similar issues with noise and trying to get fresh air in without also suffering the Rome traffic noise.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, not bad hotel”
Reviews.Author: stormdesign
Reviews.Content: I found this hotel when looking for a budget accommodation. When we arrived, check-in was quick and smooth. The room was good and clean, and the parquet floor is a nice touch. Beds were comfy and bathroom was good too. Breakfast was ok too with bread, croissants, cereals, coffee etc... Location wise, its perfect as there are a variety of restaurants in the area, plenty of sights that are close by, and best of all, the train station is really close. - there is even an internet cafe very close and a transport company that you can use to book your taxi to the airport. There was just one problem with the hot water as there wasn't any in the last 2 days of my stay. I complained but the reception guy seemed to completely ignore my complaint. There is also NO internet access, which is something most people can live without.... but not me!

Reviews.Title: “Good for the price!!!”
Reviews.Author: cubanlove
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Hotel Giada for 3 nights at end of June. The price was reasonable. I booked a single room for 65 or 70 euros and they gave me a double room!! I was definitely pleased with that. I also knew the location, as this was the 3rd time in Rome. It is situated close to the main Termini Station (convenient to roll luggage to/from station, direct from airport/other city). It is also far enough from the station that it is safe. The room and bathroom were very clean. I had no problems. There was also proper circulation in the room...in the form of air conditioning (which was necessary at the end of June). The only thing I would be weary of is the breakfast. It was simple. Edible but not the best. Coffee (any type), cereal, fruity/sugary orange drink (not juice) and a (horrible) type of baked good. But for the price and during the high summer season, I couldn't have asked for more!

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing”
Reviews.Author: WelshGirlEngland
Reviews.Content: Unfortunately the photographs of the rooms are nothing like the reality. Our tripple room on the 5th floor was large but very gloomy - there was bare grey plaster board ceiling (unpainted) and the decor and furniture generally looked tired and in need of modernisation. The room, however, was clean and the bedding was white, crisp and clean. Don't expect too much for breakfast - there isn't much choice, bread rolls are hard and stale. Crossoint and coffee are the best bet. My overall feeling is it is not good value for money and I'm sure there are better hotels in Rome for a similar price. I would say it is a 1-2 star hotel, definiately not a 3. On the plus side it is in a good position for sightseeing.

Reviews.Title: “Sketchy, and that's forgiving”
Reviews.Author: espressobean
Reviews.Content: This is the worst hotel I've ever stayed at. The elevator broke (while we were in it), the rooms are smelly, and you run out of hot water through a normal shower. The bathroom had a musty smell, that I cannot attribute to anything in particular. It is not a smell you would want to find out on your own. To cap it all off, I think we got scammed for 100 euro (fake note). That point is debateable, but this hotel is not 3 stars...and I'm surprised it is in business still. Upon check-in, I called the Hilton to book another room. That tells you something. Stay away...far, far, away.

Reviews.Title: “worst hotel ever”
Reviews.Author: IrelandNellie
Reviews.Content: this hotel was the worst place i have ever stayed the room was small dark and smelled funny. The bathroom was appalling i felt dirtier after a shower as the water stank and made me feel sick just before the hot water ran out, and it was full of insects. Mouldy walls and cracked radiators added to the over all ambience. It was like an eppisode of Fawlty Towers with out the homour. I would advise anyone staying in rome to avoid this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Good, down to earth hotel”
Reviews.Author: Camaroguy707
Reviews.Content: We recently returned from a week long stay at the Hotel Giada, a simple, smaller hotel with a nice small-ish but adequate size room, newer or remodeled clean bathroom, a big operable window overlooking a typical Roman street, marble floors, quiet, and great staff service; all for about $190/night. It's not the Ritz, but much nicer, quieter, and classier than a Holiday Inn or Motel 6. Of course the hotel is older (it's downtown Rome, remember?) but it seemed very well kept up. I can't comment on the heat or A/C; the temps were just right when we were there, so we didn't have anything turned on. This place is really centrally located, close to the train station but in walking distance of the coliseum, forum, trevi fountain, and a host of other places. Of course restaurants are everywhere close by, and all the other 'corner stores.' The public transportation in Rome is great, and you can get to anywhere from just down the street. We tipped the house keeper 5 Euro's a day and she did a really nice job. The front desk guy spoke pretty good english, and was quite informative about which bus or train for us to take. He called the American Catholic church for us and arranged tickets to see the Pope at his Wednesday audience; and, got them delivered too! It's amazing what just a simple pack of American Marlboro cigarettes can do for you! We have been all over the world, and have stayed in the best and the worst; I would recommend the Hotel Giada, and we will stay there again when we are in Rome the next time. Incidentally, on previous trips to Rome, getting out of the train station was a hassling experience - threading through rogue taxi drivers, gypsies, and what not. This time there wasn't any of that. Maybe it's all those cops with machine guns everywhere? Still, keep your guard up and valuables close to your vest.

Reviews.Title: “Cheap but very Basic”
Reviews.Author: BraveTourist
Reviews.Content: Was worried about staying here,( booked it before I read reviews, stupid I know) Excellent position, handy for Termini and the historic Centre and cheap but you get what you pay for, room was very basic, and the drains in the WC were very smelly, (discovered smell originated from shower drain). I found the staff very helpful, breakfast was simple but the coffee was good (dont touch the fruit juice - terrible). If you intend to spend alot of time in the hotel dont go here, however if it just a place to stow your gear and to sleep in a clean bed whilst you discover Rome, this is a good cheap option. No Restaurant or Bar so if you intend to arrive late take your own food and drink. Oh and check out the painting of Mother and Child on the 3rd floor its a must.

Reviews.Title: “I paid more for a less place!”
Reviews.Author: FollowThatBug
Reviews.Content: I was "moved" from the supposedly lovely B&B Maggiore on Piazza Santa Maria Maggiore to Hotel Giada due to bathroom mulfunction, and I was not impressed. The guy at the front desk, although friendly, made me think there was some kind of deal going on between my mirage B&B and this hotel. I paid 70 euros for my single room, which I later found out after reading previous Tripadvisor reviews was 10 euros more than what others had paid in the past. Hotel Giada is a couple blocks from Termini station but in an area considered seedy compared to the rest of central Rome, however at night it's not as scary or unsafe as I expected, for there are always tourists as (or more) disoriented as me. The room was horrible. My single room looked out onto a disgusting courtyard under renovation (through the narrowest window ever), and the bathroom was dilapidated. The shower was spotty, its door wouldn't close completely and the plastic cover had slits so water would seep out onto the bathroom floor and radiator. There was also no holder for the toilet paper, so the roll was left on top of the radiator..... you get the picture. I was pleasantly surprised by the breakfast. For a hotel so lack of quality, it served a good cup of cappuccino and edible pastry. The breakfast lady looked stern but turned out to be very sweet in the end and happily served me a second cup of cappuccino. I left my luggage at the front desk and spent the entire day sightseeing before taking the train to the airport a 6pm. That was the best part about this hotel - its proximity to the station.

Reviews.Title: “Avoid”
Reviews.Author: japanesetourist
Reviews.Content: If your blind, stupid then please stay in this hotel, If you have an ounce of sense AVIOD AVOID AVOID, If I could rate it I would -10000 stars. PS DO NOT BELIEVE ANY PHOTOS YOU SEE OF THIS HOTEL.

Reviews.Title: “Surprised and pleased!”
Reviews.Author: 2panache
Reviews.Content: After reading a few reviews regarding Hotel Giada, I thought that perhaps my stay in Rome would be seriously impacted. I was very pleased to find that Hotel Giada was exactly what I was looking for when I booked it. The 24 hour staff was fine; the room was great despite no air-conditioning; the room and bathroom were clean-big, clean towels daily; the breakfast room was bright and warm with a nice breakfast. The elevator was vintage but memorable. The location, 5 minutes from the Termini and within walking distance to all but Vatican City is perfect. Would recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Definitely not a 3 star hotel - traveller from Derby England”
Reviews.Author: DerbyshireBetty
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from our stay in Hotel Giada. Must admit I was dreading it as I had read the reviews on this site. The hotel was extremely basic, there were absolutely no amenities as promised on the website we booked through. The lift was shared with the hotel next door and on one occasion it was impossible to get from our 3rd floor room via the lift, as it was constantly full going down. The rooms although spacious, were extremely shabby and the furniture was old and tatty, the curtain in our room was falling down. However the beds were comfortable and the sheets were clean. The bathroom cold tap did not work and when we reported this to the reception clerk he just shrugged his shoulders and said it could not be fixed. This hotel is advertised as 3 stars, I would not give it 1 star, it is in my opinion one level away from being a hostel. The breakfast was extremely paltry and consisted of cornflakes, bread, jam and a pastry. Other comments I have read said that it was a cheap hotel, so you get what you pay for, we paid nearly 95.00 per night- not cheap in my opinion!! The area around the hotel, although not the best, was not as intimidating as we anticipated, and we did not feel threatened, we saw plenty of vagrants in Rome, but not too many around the hotel. The noisy drunken scots staying in the hotel next door were far more intimidating!!!

Reviews.Title: “A Great cheap hotel in the heart of Rome”
Reviews.Author: jonahbella
Reviews.Content: This place was a steal. Clean, right in centro storico (historic center), and CHEAP. Sixty euro a night for a room in the heart of Rome! I'm not sure why this place got bad reviews. I've stayed at much worse in Rome for twice the price. Would book it again in a heartbeat.

Reviews.Title: “I dont recommend the room 34 !”
Reviews.Author: Violeta1
Reviews.Content: Well I do not want to generalize the hotel, and as such, I do not go to say that the hotel is all bad, but the truth, is that the photos of the brochure, had been an illusion. we were in room 34. I do not recommend this room to nobody ..... The walls were dirty, the room did not have decoration, much less comfort. (if i pay good, i want the minimum) The WC was clean, however the towels had bad smell , but worse then that it was when the towel of supposedly clean bath, brought of toast a monkey! Yes a monkey! The breakfast is weak and.....I asked to the lady make a toast and.... the answer was...."Sorry, no " if you stay there....dont forget to visit the 5º floor to see the pictures in the wall ! I want to believe that the other rooms are well more pleasant, cleaner and comfortable. Unhappyly I do not have nothing to point out of good. When I saw the website, I didnt wanted to believe that we had been in the same hotel… ! If you dont belive see for your self...

Reviews.Title: “Happily Surprised”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I was quite worried about staying here due to the nature of some previous reviews. However we were pleasantly surprised. Our room (number 11) was a good size and very clean, it even had a balcony. The bathroom was small, but clean. Cleanliness was a major worry before we got there, but could not fault it. The breakfast was more than adequate, with good coffee. The orange juice could have been better though. I would recommend this hotel for a good budget break. The location was good too, 25 minute walk to Spanish Steps, a bit less to Trevi Fountain.

Reviews.Title: “good clean”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Good clean cheap and very central Ideal for a short break Amenities nearby most sites within walking distance Staff vey helpful Would recommend and use again

Reviews.Title: “This place was great.”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This place was more than adequate, all of these people that complain "well the breakfast room is ugly" or that the staff was not that friendly, quit being so high maintenance. First, you are in Rome, you should be only staying in that hotel to sleep, as long as it has a clean room and adequate bed, what more do you need? There is so much to do in that city that the last place to be would be your hotel room. Moreover, the staff was great there. I remember when a buddy and I went to Rome for spring break, we accidentally fell asleep upon our arrival because the flight was so long. We actually both passed out with the door to the room open with all of our money out there. The staff came in locked up our stuff in the room safe and there was nothing missing. Also the front desk gentlemen was very helpful on things to do in the city and what to avoid. This place is great for those who are not high maintenance.

Reviews.Title: “Not as bad as some reviews”
Reviews.Author: knocklofty
Reviews.Content: Hotel basic and clean. No problem with staff all spoke good English and friendly. Room small and basic clean and no problem with hot water.Breakfast could be better but adequate.

Reviews.Title: “enjoyed our stay at this hotel.”
Reviews.Author: Bex57
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel Giada and found the rooms to be clean, including the bathroom. The breakfast was nice and the staff were friendly. The hotel is within easy reach of all the sights and we didn't feel threatened by the area. i must admit that we were dreading our stay there because of all the bad reviews, we enjoyed ourselves and would stay there again for a low budget break.

Reviews.Title: “What a Disaster”
Reviews.Author: Franzosish57
Reviews.Content: I never normally write reviews of things but the trauma caused by staying here forced my hand. The Hotel looks very poor so the area. The room I was allocated was no bigger than a prison cell and the bathroom could probably be nominated in the guinness book of records for the most constrictive space in which to wash and use the toilet honestly aircraft bathrooms are bigger. The room was very old and dirty. Breakfast consisted of continental buffet where everythinh had an inverse temperature that could be dangerous for the body. Everything that should heve been cold ( like milk for cereals, fruit juices ) was warm and everything that should have been warm ( like coffee, tea ) was tiepid. Please if you take one piece of advise from this web site, do not stay here and find a better place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Giada”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Excellent location, friendly and helpful staff, clean rooms and nice area. Value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Beware of this one”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Do not stay at this hotel. My husband and I stayed for 03 nights, the bed sheets were dirty, we did tell about this to the man at the front desk but when we arrived back to the hotel in the evening the same dirty bedding was on the bed. Long black hairs were all over the bed, sheets, and bedspread. The shower overflowed into the room each time a shower was taken. Had to stand outside in the bathroom to wash and get back in the shower to rinse off. The Hotel is very old, poor, nasty, smelly and bad service.The breakfast room and the food are horrible. The day of check out the maid entered the room at 10am and asked us to leave so she could clean the room. The area is very bad and unsafe far from everything. I will complain with my travel agent and of course i would not recommend this place to anyone. Do Not Stay Here.

Reviews.Title: “Dreadful”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed two nights in this hotel and I would advise anyone thinking of staying here to choose another Hotel. The room was cramped, smelly, old, dark and not at all up to the standard. The net curtains were filty and the bathroom was old and tatty. The area near Termini Station is horrible and unsafe. The breakfast room was ugly and the food was just disgusting so the tea and coffe. Generally not very helpful staff. I know the price is cheap but as the saying goes " you get what uou pay for " but in this case I would not stay here even in they pay me.

HotelInfo.Name: Hotel Giada
HotelInfo.Address: Via Principe Amedeo, 9, 00185 Rome, Italy
